Articles.Content:
Several folks on the EPL, and MKS/OKS threads have been complaining about the cost of Kerbals. I looked it up on the wiki and the cost is apparently: 150n^2+12350n, for the nth hire. This seems kind of silly and makes it prohibitively expensive to run large space programs with multiple stations and bases on different bodies. Some folks have suggested a mod to breed Kerbals, but wouldn't fixing the hiring cost of Kerbal's be a simpler/more logical solution? You don't have to worry about male/female ratios, time in flight, room, skipping childhood, genetics or anything else. Simply making it so the hiring cost makes sense would be ideal for most applications. Maybe make the price inversely proportional to rep (probably plus some base constant) and make it so you have serious hits to your rep if a Kerbal dies. The current cost formula only makes sense if the Kerbal population is very very small or your killing Kerbals left and right.

So, how difficult or easy is it to mod the cost of hiring Kerbals?

Never hired them anyway. All my Kerbals apart from the 4 official onces are brought down from various rescue contracts. Increasing costs of hiring each new additional Kerbal is mildly speaking illogical.

Imagine I have a restaurant and each additional waiter costs me more than the previous one?

> 
> So, how difficult or easy is it to mod the cost of hiring Kerbals?

As easy as installing the [mod that already does it](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121100)
Oh. I didn't realize your mod did that. I thought it just affected the buildings upgrade cost and when various feature are unlocked.
